subject: Management
title: When to Collaborate
description: A short lesson to help you apply When to Collaborate.

hook.text: Marketing wanted a big launch. Engineering wanted a quiet beta. They found a third option nobody had considered.

buildup.text: Collaboration seeks a solution where both sides fully get what they need. It takes more time.

discovery.text: Use collaboration when the relationship matters and the issue is too important to compromise on.

twist.text: Collaboration isn't splitting the difference. It's finding an entirely new answer together.

climax.text: The third option was a staged launch: beta users first, big reveal a month later. Both sides won.

punchline.text: The best solution is often one neither side imagined alone.

quiz.question: When is collaboration the best conflict style?
options: When the relationship and the issue are both too important to compromise
When speed is more important than the quality of the solution
When one side clearly has the better argument
